content: Look in the portable's Data folder for a folder called Profile. You can verify by seeing if it contains abook.sqlite or prefs.js as those two are in all profiles. You can import it by tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation.
creator: davidsk

content: I imported from here: Choose a profile Folder C:\Desktop\myPrograms\ThunderBird\ThunderbirdPortable\App\Thunderbird64\ThunderbirdPortable\Data\profile That Folder contains lots of Files including: abook.sqlite or prefs.js , But none of the other email acounts . What can I do next ? Thanks
creator: vmars3161

content: That's the one. It has everything. You can use it by the tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation menu option from menu bar. Be sure that the portable version is NOT running.
creator: davidsk

content: You can check by logging onto your online account to see if the accounts are shown as junk before starting Thunderbird.

content: Knowing how you transferred to the new PC may help. On your questions, Thunderbird did not prompt you for a password on prior PC because it stores the password for you. You (or someone for you) set that password back in 2019. Spectrum uses mobile.charter.net as one of its email servers, so your use of it is not unexpected.

Di certo non dipende da Thunderbird.
creator: @next

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help

You are permanently on a blacklist after using your email accounts. The moment you clearly no longer receive emails in your inbox due to this, you are guilty of the term "Bounce", which means that you have used email software where spam-like activities have been found. You can use free online software to check whether they have registered for this. For example, a DNS checker or Debouncer.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there


The method is if you are registered and you use an IP blacklist for email software, you can assume that better behavior will pay off and you will show less and less spam behavior that you will be removed from this list again. It is true that if you were to continuously appear on this list, it would become increasingly difficult to get off this list.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there


You can request a "delistings list" which would probably require you to fill out a form and adhere to the rules.


Greetings firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there

There are a number of lists you can end up with, such as the term white listing and also gray listing. This term already tells you what it means. White listing is for approving email addresses, servers, and IP addresses.

gray listing is for the use of to prevent you from ending up on a blacklist.



Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there


If you have time for this, you can visit the online site "Spamhaus" and register there. You will then be asked if you can enter your IP address for further assistance. Register here and enter your IP address or domain name of the relevant one and ask to look it up. You can easily follow the instructions to get rid of this list.

If you also have a Microsoft account, you can also register here and log in to the Microsoft delistings portal. Here you can request the well-known deregistration form regarding your current situation? This will be recorded and processed for an assessment.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content: If you do not know your password, you need to contact your email provider to reset it. Thunderbird can retain it for you, but cannot assist in getting a new one.

content: It's been frustrating that I can't use Thunderbird as it does not allow me to send emails although SMTP settnigs are correct. What should I do?
creator: popovic.marko

content:
Solved:-)

Hello everyone, I've found the cause of the problem.

It was my mail signatures, which I had saved in html files. The css in them broke the ListItems. Now everything is working fine again.

Maybe helpful for one or the other who runs into this problem.
creator: patrick.lanners

content: First, I suggest looking in File Explorer to verify that the inbox itself is that size, and not a combination of files. I mention this because sometimes users report a large size when, in fact, it is multiple temporary files from failed compactions. Normally, compacting the file works. If you exit TB and delete the inbox & inbox.msf, thunderbird will repopulate it on restart. No need to recreate the account.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the tip. I couldn't compress, because of to less disk space remaining.

Meanwhile, my first approach to set the files local to a 180 days and deleting some bigger mails somehow did the job.
creator: johannes45

content:
Ještě jsem dohledával informace v mezinárodním support fóru a narazil jsem na toto: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1869543 Zdá se, že problém je převážně na počítačích HP a Win11, což je i můj. Jistým řešením je vytvoření .bat souboru, který manuálně spustí službu zařazování tisku. Tzn. v poznámkovém bloku napsat následující:

net stop spooler net start spooler net stop spooler del C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\*.shd del C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\*.spl net start spooler

Toto uložit např. na plochu s názvem souboru *.bat a po té, co Thundrbird vypne službu zařazování, spustit tento .bat soubor jako správce, čímž dojde k obnově služby zařazování tisku a je možno normálně tisknout ze všech aplikací. Hrozné řešení, ale zatím to nejlepší, které jsem našel. A funguje.
creator: j.wyderka

content: Ciao, devi essere più dettagliato. Qual è il provider della tua casella email? La casella è configurata come IMAP o POP3? Oltre che da Thunderbird accedi da altri dispositivi (browser, app, smartphone, etc.) Thunderbird visualizza qualche messaggio di errore quando provi a scaricare la posta?
creator: @next

content: sure. here are the steps: - exit thunderbird - locate profile - click imapmail profile and then copy the yahoo profile to the server. Give it whatever name you like - start thunderbird - highlight account and right-click - select settings - click to 'server settings' - click the bottom item that points to account and change to the location of the server account that you just set up. - this will require a thunderbird restart - on restart, recheck to see that all is working ok. You can now delete the folder on your PC that you copied from.
creator: davidsk

content: Changing medium to large is an HTML process. You might first consider why you want recipients to receive your emails in a large font. Some may find it offensive, as they may prefer to set their own font size. Your replies are also in large font when replying in HTML. You may need to change settings to always send HTML, regardless of style changes. When you receive messages, are they of acceptable size? That is, my real question is whether you want recipients to see messages in a large font, or is it just for yourself to see messages in large font? This may seem picky, but the solutions are different for each. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: First, please understand that you are posting to the people who have no authority for anything. Your complaint is posted daily here, multiple times, and has been happening since 102 was rolled out in 2022. There is a 'fix' for the dreaded threading feature. Let me know if interested. It's messy, but it works. Want to avoid all future updates? Let me know, as it's doable. Another possibility is to download ver 91. It works smoothly and the profile is compatible, once you delete the compatibility.ini file. It is possible to set up 91 with updates disabled. I have a copy working now and most addons for it are still available. HOWEVER, you are dissatisfied, adding your voice at connect.microsoft.org may help. Click to IDEAS and voice your displeasure there. Let me know. But please, we're just workerbees here. :)
creator: davidsk
